head.title: The Wild and the Tame In Berries and Cream

hedline.hl1: The Wild and the Tame In Berries and Cream

block.p: The intensity of wild strawberries, fraises des bois, separates Creme Cremaillere's newest flavor from other strawberry ice creams. The rich, satiny and not oversweet custard-based ice cream, made at La Cremaillere, a restaurant in Westchester County, also contains tame strawberries to round out the flavor and provide pieces of berry, said Robert Meyzen, the owner. The wild strawberries come from France already pureed, so the ice cream is available all year. It's $3.50 to $4 a pint at markets, including Eli's Manhattan and the Vinegar Factory, Amish Markets, Gourmet Garage markets and Mrs. Green's Natural Markets in Westchester and Connecticut.
